meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with pegs again.
meanings.sent1: She repegs the tent to make sure it stays in place.
meanings.sent2: He always repegs his favorite hat to his backpack before hiking.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel repegs the acorn in a different spot every time.
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting over repegs her determination to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The gardener repegs the loose fence with precision and care.

meanings.definition: To remove pegs from a surface or object.
meanings.sent1: He repegs the old posters from the wall to put up new ones.
meanings.sent2: She carefully repegs the clothesline to take down the laundry.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy repegs the toys from the basket all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The detective repegs the evidence board, trying to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter repegs the damaged wood to repair the structure.

meanings.definition: A peg used for fastening or securing.
meanings.sent1: She grabs a handful of repegs to secure the tarpaulin in place.
meanings.sent2: The toolbox contains various sizes of repegs for different tasks.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulls a never-ending string of repegs from his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The repegs in the puzzle box hold the pieces together until solved.
meanings.sent5: The artist uses colorful repegs to create a unique mosaic design.
